title: Mark Nicolson
text:
Mark Nicolson is an American tenor <a href="opera">opera</a> singer residing in <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a>.
Mark Nicolson was born in <a href="Galesburg%2C%20Illinois">Galesburg, Illinois</a> and grew up in <a href="Peoria%2C%20Illinois">Peoria, Illinois</a>, where he attended <a href="Bradley%20University">Bradley University</a>. He subsequently studied at <a href="University%20of%20North%20Texas%20College%20of%20Music">University of North Texas College of Music</a> and <a href="Jacobs%20School%20of%20Music">Indiana University</a>, where he studied with <a href="bel-canto">bel-canto</a> soprano, <a href="Virginia%20Zeani">Virginia Zeani</a> and bass, <a href="Nicola%20Rossi-Lemeni">Nicola Rossi-Lemeni</a>. He later studied with tenor legends <a href="Franco%20Corelli">Franco Corelli</a> and <a href="James%20King%20%28tenor%29">James King</a>. In New York, he won the <a href="Liederkranz%20of%20the%20City%20of%20New%20York">Liederkranz Competition</a>, received a Citation of Excellence from the <a href="Birgit%20Nilsson%20Prize">Birgit Nilsson Prize</a> Competition, won five study grants from the New York Wagner Society, and received a fellowship from <a href="Jerome%20Hines">Jerome Hines</a> Opera-Music Theatre Institute. He is on the voice faculty of <a href="New%20Jersey%20City%20University">New Jersey City University</a>.
